chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: So it is giving my local time

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: Now what I am doing here, I am printing hour, minute and seconds

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: In this format that hour will come in place of %h

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: Minute will come in place of %m and second will come in place of %s

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: It will give me only hour and it will give me only minute

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: Obviously I am using strf time and it will give me second

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: I hope you guys understood this thing

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: After this, anyone can solve it, anyone can solve it

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: Then there is no problem in listening

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: That is the biggest hint I am going to say

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: That you use int

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: Because this will not be your integer

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: If you are doing something like greater than or less than

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: Then you will not get to see greater than or less than with string

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
chunks.text: You will not be able to do it, it will be problematic

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3

chunks.title: Exercise 2- Good Morning Sir .mp3
